9.00.text: Best lady organist I’ve ever had.

12.09.text: Pulls out all the stops, does she?

15.85.text: How did you entertain our friend?

18.17.text: We took him out for a drink.

19.97.text: Oh? Where did you take him?

22.72.text: We dropped him off Hammersmith Bridge.

23.92.text: That should have quenched his thirst!

27.88.text:
I may be a poor defenceless woman, but any
more of your lip and I shall kick you from

34.05.text: here to the Elephant and Castle!

37.00.text:
“‘Emery Presents: Legacy of Murder’,
starting next Tuesday at 8 o’clock on BBC

44.32.text:
“The sixth frame of the snooker championship
‘Pot Black’ is about to start on BBC Two.

50.49.text:
“And here on BBC One in twenty five minutes
our ‘Play for Today’ is ‘The Silly Season’,

54.57.text:
the story of four students working in a factory
who find that theory doesn’t always match

60.50.text:
“First the nine o’clock news with John
Humphrys.”

76.80.text:
“Sir Freddie Laker says he hopes to be back
in business with ‘a people’s airline’.

82.55.text:
“The train driver who defied his union and
went to work.

86.71.text:
“Mr Haig gets tough with the Russians over
Poland and says we’re at a critical crossroads

93.13.text:
“A plane crashes in Tokyo Bay and most of
the passengers survived.

98.20.text:
“And Bill Beaumont takes his doctor’s
advice: no more rugby for England or anyone

104.52.text:
Good evening. Sir Freddy Laker broke his silence
tonight and said he was actively thinking

112.26.text:
His announcement came, he said, because of
the great support he’s received over the

115.67.text:
last few days and the Ser… Suv… Save Sir
Freddie Funds.

120.35.text: He said he was deeply grateful, and went on:

122.85.text:
“As a result of the enormous public support
I am actively exploring a new airline project.

128.07.text:
“And future plans include public participation,
‘the people’s airline’.”

131.70.text:
Sir Freddie’s startling new plans were announced
as the receivers were beginning to sell off

137.20.text:
the package holiday side of his organisation.
This afternoon the receiver, Mr Bill Mackie,

145.04.text:
There’s no indication so far as to whether
the receivers have found a purchaser or not.

150.35.text: Clive Ferguson reports now on the offers.

153.53.text:
“Long before the dramatic statement from
Sir Freddie, there was a steady stream of

157.93.text:
callers to the receivers offices, all interested
in the accountant’s assessment…”
